comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She's art historian Rosamond Jean Lambert Brockway (usually found as Jean L. Brockway) (1899-1992), born in Cedar Falls IA, died in Vermont. Here's a record of her gravesite: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Lamber... Her husband was Thomas Parmelee Brockway (b. 1898), a historian connected with Bennington College. There's an oral history interview with Thomas, created in 1984: oralhistoryportal.cul.columbia.edu/document.php?id=ldpd_4... See also: Jean Lambert Brockway, "Trumbull's Sortie," The Art Bulletin16(1)(March 1934): 4-13. Jean Lambert Brockway, "The Miniatures of James Peale," Antiques (October 1932): 130-134. Jean Lambert Brockway, "William Birch: His American Enamel Portraits,"Antiques 24(1933): 94-96. Jean Lambert Brockway, "Unpublished Miniatures by Benjamin Trott," Antiques 20(August 1931): 81. Jean Lambert Brockway, "Malbone, American Miniature Painter," American Magazine of Art 20(4)(April 1929): 186.
